name: 2-Hydroxy-1,2-diphenylethanone

The compound contains a benzophenone backbone, two phenyl rings, a carbonyl group, and a hydroxyl group. Each phenyl group tends to increase the melting point due to the increased rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, which we can estimate as +20 degrees each. The carbonyl group contributes to the rigidity of the molecule and can also participate in hydrogen bonding, resulting in an increase of the melting point, estimated at +10 degrees. The hydroxyl group forms intermolecular hydrogen bonds which significantly increase the melting point. The hydrogen bonding effect of the hydroxyl group can be estimated at +40 degrees. The overall predicted melting point shift would be the sum of the individual contributions.
